p: No regulated fungal species were identified across collection sites. A total of 36 genera consisting of ten or more species were detected across sampling locations (Figure 5). Three out of the 36 genera ( Alternaria, Diaporthe, and Fusarium) which have species represented on Canadian regulatory lists were successfully detected with a high percentage of pairwise genetic identity (≥ 98%) in all location sites (Figure 5). The number of fungal genera comprising regulated species per location ranged from three to six, with the traps placed in Barrie in August 2018 containing the lowest fungal diversity (Figure 5).
